content:
Diagnosis:	Malignant pleural mesothelioma (sarcomatoid type)

Staging:	T4N2M0 at diagnosis March 2024
	BAP1 loss, PD-L1 TPS 90%

Treatment:	1. Carboplatin/Pemetrexed - 2 cycles (March-April 2024)
	2. Nivolumab commenced May 2024

Current Status:	Clinical and radiological disease progression

[redacted name] has unfortunately shown clear evidence of disease progression on recent imaging. CT thorax 12/6/24 demonstrates increasing right pleural thickening with new chest wall invasion and enlarging mediastinal lymphadenopathy. There is a new moderate left pleural effusion. Performance status has declined to ECOG 3, with increasing dyspnoea at rest requiring 4L/min oxygen. Weight has dropped 4kg since last review.

Bloods show rising inflammatory markers with CRP 156, normal renal and liver function. Latest cardiac ejection fraction 52% (down from 58%).

I have had a detailed discussion with [redacted name] and family regarding disease progression. We have agreed to discontinue immunotherapy in view of clear progression and declining performance status. Referral made to palliative care team for symptom management, particularly focusing on breathlessness. Will arrange urgent pleural aspiration for symptomatic relief.

Plan:	1. Discontinue nivolumab
	2. Urgent pleural aspiration
	3. Palliative care review this week
	4. Weekly telephone review by specialist nurse
	5. Next clinic review in 2 weeks or sooner if needed
